Module it.polimi.ingsw.PSP034
Package it.polimi.ingsw.PSP034.view.CLI.scenes.playPhase

Class Table

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP034.view.CLI.scenes.Scene
it.polimi.ingsw.PSP034.view.CLI.scenes.playPhase.Table
public class Table
extends Scene
This class creates the scene to be printed when the game table has to be shown.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Table​(String[] gods, String[] players, PlayerColor[] colors)
    Creates the scene and organizes the objects.

  • Constructor Details

    • Table

      public Table​(String[] gods, String[] players, PlayerColor[] colors)
      Creates the scene and organizes the objects.
      Parameters:
      gods - The gods that are being used in the game.
      players - The names of players that are playing.
      colors - The colors of the players. Note that the order of the colors must be the same as the names of the players.

  • Method Details

    • show

      public String show()
      Initializes and organizes the elements of the scene and then prints the whole scene using the printMain method. If the scene needs an input from the user, the regex that check the input are defined in this method.
      Specified by:
      show in class Scene
      Returns:
      The input of the user. What these input represents depends on the last update function called.

    • updateBoard

      public void updateBoard​(boolean[][] dome, int[][] building, PlayerColor[][] color, Sex[][] sex, boolean showNumbers)
      Updates the board.
      Parameters:
      dome - Matrix that indicates whether a tile has a dome or not.
      building - Matrix that indicates the height of the building on each tile.
      color - Matrix that indicates the color of the worker on each tile. If a tile has no worker, the value for that tile must be NULL.
      sex - Matrix that indicates the sex of the worker on each tile. If a tile has no worker, the value for that tile must be NULL.
      showNumbers - Whether the number of each tile that has no worker nor dome must be shown or not.

    • updatePlaceWorker

      public void updatePlaceWorker​(boolean[][] dome, int[][] building, PlayerColor[][] color, Sex[][] sex, Sex worker)
      Updates the scene asking the user where he/she wants to place a worker.
      Parameters:
      dome - Matrix that indicates whether a tile has a dome or not.
      building - Matrix that indicates the height of the building on each tile.
      color - Matrix that indicates the color of the worker on each tile. If a tile has no worker, the value for that tile is NULL.
      sex - Matrix that indicates the sex of the worker on each tile. If a tile has no worker, the value for that tile is NULL.
      worker - The sex of the worker to be placed.

    • updateOtherPlacing

      public void updateOtherPlacing​(String playerName)
      Updates the scene communicating to the user that another player is placing workers.
      Parameters:
      playerName - Name of the player that is placing workers.

    • updateSelectWorker

      public void updateSelectWorker​(String action)
      Updates the scene asking to the user which worker he/she wants to select for the next action.
      Parameters:
      action - The name of the next action.

    • updateMove

      public void updateMove​(@NotNull @NotNull Sex sex, int workerX, int workerY, Directions[] possibleDirections, boolean hasChoice)
      Updates the scene asking the user where he/she wants to move the selected worker.
      Parameters:
      sex - The sex of the worker to be moved.
      workerX - x coordinates of the starting tile.
      workerY - y coordinates of the starting tile.
      possibleDirections - List of the possible direction for the movement.
      hasChoice - Whether the user can change the selected worker or not.

    • updateBuild

      public void updateBuild​(@NotNull @NotNull Sex sex, int workerX, int workerY, Directions[] possibleDirections, boolean hasChoice)
      Updates the scene asking the user where he/she wants to build with the selected worker.
      Parameters:
      sex - The sex of the worker to build with.
      workerX - x coordinates of the tile of the worker.
      workerY - y coordinates of the tile of the worker.
      possibleDirections - List of the possible direction for the build.
      hasChoice - Whether the user can change the selected worker or not.

    • updatePower

      public void updatePower()
      Updates the scene asking the user whether he/she wants to use a god power.

    • updateStart

      public void updateStart()
      Updates the scene changing the title to "your turn" and clearing any request shown.

    • updateOtherStarting

      public void updateOtherStarting​(String playerName)
      Updates the scene communicating to the user that another player's turn is starting.
      Parameters:
      playerName - Name of the player whose turn is starting.

    • updateEnd

      public void updateEnd()
      Updates the scene changing the title to "your turn ended" and clearing any request shown.

    • updateDefeat

      public void updateDefeat​(@NotNull @NotNull String winnerName, @NotNull @NotNull String[] losersNames) throws NullPointerException
      Updates the scene communicating to the user that he/she lost. If another player won the winning player's name is communicate too.
      Parameters:
      winnerName - Name of the winning player. If there is no winner this value must be NULL.
      losersNames - Name of the losing players.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the losing player or the winning player cannot be found an exception is thrown.

    • updateRemovePlayer

      public void updateRemovePlayer​(String loser) throws NullPointerException
      Updates the scene communicating to the user that another player lost and removing the color from the losing player card.
      Parameters:
      loser - Name of the losing player.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the losing player cannot be found an exception is thrown.

    • updateWin

      public void updateWin​(String winnerName) throws NullPointerException
      Updates the scene communicating to the user that he/she won.
      Parameters:
      winnerName - Name of the winning player.
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - If the winning player cannot be found an exception is thrown.

    • updateClearRequest

      public void updateClearRequest()
      Updates the scene clearing any request shown.
